title: Add high-level theory/guiding principles
body:
Most people don't have the time or energy to read through the entire style guide and internalize it. Additionally, there are always going to be gaps that we haven't explicitly handled.

For both of these cases, I think it would be nice to add a few concise guiding principles to the document. This would allow people to essentially "memorize these 6 ideas and you will know what to do 99% of the time."

I don't know what these principles are or should be, but I figured I would get the discussion started here.

title: UNMET PEER DEPENDENCY with eslint@^3.9.1
body:
* node: v6.9.1
* npm: v3.10.8

I install the lastest version of eslint in global first. And then I install the eslint-config-airbnb.But there are something trouble with it :
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/18140164/20238599/0df62cfa-a92a-11e6-8a06-a1bc2efdbf7e.png)

I try to `npm uninstall -g eslint-config-airbnb`, `npm cache clean` and reinstall again . It doesn't worked for me.

Is there anything trouble with the version number in the `package.json`?

sorry for bothering..

title: Extend `import/no-extraneous-dependencies` ignore list
body:
What do you think about adding follow patterns to ignore list?

```js
'test.js',
'test-*.js',
'**/*.test.js',
```

Like in [AVA](https://github.com/avajs/ava-files/blob/master/index.js#L22-L26)

title: Add information about NaN comparisons
body: You mention NaN evaluates to false but don't explicitly mention that any comparison to NaN evalutes to false, including NaN === NaN.  Added a note about this at the bottom of that section.

title: Error on eslint-config-airbnb v13.0.0
body:
Hi Guys, I have updated my eslint-config-airbnb to v13.0.0, when I run `npm test` the following error occurs, I have installed "eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y", does anyone meet this problem?

> Module build failed: Error: /Users/Welly/Desktop/react-cool-starter/node_modules/eslint-config-airbnb/rules/react-a11y.js:
	Configuration for rule "jsx-a11y/anchor-has-content" is invalid:
	Value "" is the wrong type.

title: Fix small mistake in README
body: Now that line is not looking like comment

title: Added some ignore pattern for import/no-extraneous-dependencies
body: Close https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/issues/1168

title: "Missing trailing comma" for function arguments with JSX
ignore 'import/no-extraneous-dependencies' devDependencies checking for webpack files?
body:
Maybe `gulpfile.js`, `Gruntfile` or other task runner files also can be listed to ignore.

```js
'import/no-extraneous-dependencies': ['error', {
  devDependencies: [
    'spec/**', 
    'test/**', 
    'tests/**', 
    '**/__tests__/**',
    'webpack.config.js',
    'webpack.config.*.js',
    'gulpfile.js',
    'Gruntfile',
  ],
  optionalDependencies: false,
}],
```

Any feedback?

title: Fixed a Arguement Error
body: func_name_matching had off and always together.

title: Documentation of arrow-parens shows wrong default
body: As of http://eslint.org/docs/rules/arrow-parens.html the default option is "always" which enforces parentheses in all cases but as defined in https://github.com/airbnb/javascript#arrows--one-arg-parens the actual default option is "as-needed".

title: Update syntax in  eol-last examples
body:
Hi All 👋

The syntax used in the examples for the eol-last rule was bugging me a little and I thought I'd suggest something more es6y!
Out with the old, in with the new!

title: [guide] Separate 19.2 code blocks into diff + javascript sections
body: Section 19.2 had a huge code block with both a git diff and javascript code. This change splits the code block into two parts, one with diff highlighting and one with javascript highlighting.

title: Updated case of bullets and added a quotes example
Corrected case
body: Updated case to read the same in multiple spots. Added single quote example

title: Use num++ instead of num ++
body: I've never seen anyone do `num ++`, people don't do that. So I changed it to `num++` so it is more realistic and reflects actual common practices.

title: 2 corrections
body:
* I think you meant "Always use `let` to declare variables", as `const` declares a constant, not a variable. Although one could argue that a constant is a subtype of a variable, hence my more generic wording
* The only valid ES syntax is parenthesis around multiple arrow-function arguments, reworded accordingly

title: Update JSX quote style rationale.
body:
Based on https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/issues/629#issuecomment-166384924.

Let‘s spread the use of curly quotes and make the web a more readable place.

title: DailyJS is not longer being published
Add topic about spaces in comments
body: #998 Add topic about spaces in comments
